subject: More Announcements to consider - time sensitive
content:
On behalf of Emory’s Women in STEM organization, You are invited  to their annual Networking Night!
 
Join us on Wednesday, April 2nd, from 6-8 PM in the Math and Science Center (MSC) E208. This event will feature a panel of women professionals from STEM fields, who will share their experiences and discuss what it’s like to work in these roles, as well as their journeys as women in STEM. The event will be informal and relaxed, with pizza and refreshments provided. It’s a fantastic opportunity to meet professors, graduate students, and network with others in our community.
If you’re interested in attending, please RSVP here: https://tr.ee/v9QfhkjLRQ
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
____________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________
 
 
SUMMER RESEARCH PROGRAM: AI Xperience 
Emory’s Center for AI Learning invites students to apply to AI.Xperience, its summer applied research program. In this program, students will have the opportunity to grow their data science and programming skills with hands-on learning. To be selected, students need to:·
	•	Have been enrolled in classes in the spring 2025 semester and be enrolled at Emory in the fall 2024 semester
	•	Attend 3 or 4 team meetings per week
	•	Be able to commit roughly 20 hours per week to the project over the 6-week period
	•	Have knowledge of common statistical analysis and machine learning methods
	•	Have experience programming in R and/or PythonAll interested students should apply by 11:59 PM on March 29, 2025. We look forward to reviewing your applications!
APPLY
 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Sadie Hannans
Undergraduate Program Coordinator
Department of Quantitative Theory & Methods
Emory University
Email: shanna9@emory.edu | 470-620-7981
(she/her/hers)

subject: APPLICATION DEADLINE EXTENDED
content:
APPLICATION DEADLINE EXTENDED  -  MARCH 31ST  IT IS NOT TOO LATE TO JOIN!!!
 
LEARN MORE ABOUT THE QTM AMBASSADORS COHORT ON THE QTM WEBSITE
 
https://quantitative.emory.edu/opportunities/ambassadors.html
 
 
APPLICATIONS ARE OPEN TO JOIN THE QTM DEPARTMENT AMBASSADORS TEAM  FOR AY 2025 - 26.  
 
QTM Ambassadors are a selective cohort of sophomores, juniors, and seniors who are committed to service and leadership in the QTM community. As the department's student representatives, Ambassadors will engage with our external advisory board, assist with programming, and cultivate professional skills and relationships that will prove to be valuable long after graduation.
 
Here are a few requirements and opportunities:
 
	•	Must be a QTM major or QTM minor
	•	Must have a strong sense of responsibility
	•	Must be available to meet on Fridays for 1 hour at least twice a month between the hours of 3:00 PM – 4:30 PM
	•	Network with external partners
	•	Support faculty and staff with QTM events
	•	Build your professional portfolio 
	•	For more requirements and opportunities,  see QTM website : https://quantitative.emory.edu/opportunities/ambassadors.html
 
Application link is available below and on the QTM website.  Applications are due March 31st 
 
 
QTM Ambassador Application (2025 - 2026)
 
We love for you to join us!
 
 
Sadie Hannans
Undergraduate Program Coordinator
Department of Quantitative Theory & Methods
Emory University
Email: shanna9@emory.edu | 470-620-7981
(she/her/hers)

subject: REMINDER - QTM Advising Meeting on Friday - March 28th at 1:15PM
content:
REMINDER – QTM DEPARTMENT ADVISING MEETING ON FRIDAY, MARCH 28TH at 1:15 PM – 2:30 PM
 
There will be an Advising Meeting on March 28th at 1:15 PM – 2:30 PM in the Psychology Building (PAIS) in room 290 with Dr. Jin Kim, Dr. Kevin McAlister, and Dr. Allison Cuttner.  Please be in attendance as this meeting will serve for pre-registration questions, important information and reminders, and also announcements regarding changes and upcoming events.  
If you do not have a QTM advisor assigned yet, please especially be in attendance.  All QTM students are expected to attend. 
 
Regarding Fall 2025 QTM 302W 
 
Instructions for those who would like to register for Fall 2025 QTM 320W Technical Writing course,
 
Please refer to the notes and links in atlas regarding this course.  Those who are interested in enrolling in this course Fall 2025, please fill out the form before Friday,  March 28th.    Filling out the form does not guarantee you a permission code for enrollment.  Selections for permission codes will be determined by Dr. Jin Kim after he has viewed the list.   Those that are selected will received their permission codes to register for the course by March 31st.
 
Best,
 
Sadie Hannans
Undergraduate Program Coordinator
Department of Quantitative Theory & Methods
Emory University
Email: shanna9@emory.edu | 470-620-7981
(she/her/hers)

ANNOUNCEMENT
 
Message for rising seniors who may be interested in applying for our CMBC Undergraduate Fellowship.
 The Center for Mind, Brain, and Culture invites undergraduates to apply for our interdisciplinary research fellowship.  This fellowship provides undergraduate researchers with intellectual and professional development opportunities through participation in the vibrant, interdisciplinary intellectual community of the Center.
 
Students awarded the CMBC undergraduate fellowship will:
·         Participate in regular networking lunches
·         Interact with CMBC graduate certificate students and core faculty  
·         Enjoy special access to CMBC events and visiting scholars
·         Be eligible to request up to $500 in funding for interdisciplinary research and/or conference participation
 Students apply in the spring of their junior year for award in the senior year.  The fellowship is yearlong, beginning at
the start of the fall semester and running through the last day of spring classes.  Priority will be given to students 
conducting research (literature or data based; e.g. honors projects, research partners, and independent studies) 
in an area relevant to mind, brain, or culture.
 
Eligibility
·         Eligible applicants include all Emory undergraduate students
·         Applicants must be in their junior year seeking senior year fellowship support
Application Deadline - Monday, April 28, 2025  (last day of classes)
Notification Date - Thursday, May 1, 2025 
  
Additional details and instructions for application submission may be found on our website. 
 
If you have further questions about the application process, please contact 
CMBC Program Coordinator, Tamara Beck. 
 
Center for Mind, Brain, and Culture
36 Eagle Row, #464
Atlanta, GA  30322
(404) 727-1134
cmbc@emory.edu
http://www.cmbc.emory.edu/
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
ANOUNCEMENT
 
 
The priority deadline to apply to be a STEM mentor for Georgia Science Education Initiative's (GSEI) summer Data Detective program is this Friday! If you are staying on campus over the summer, 
this is a great opportunity to gain volunteer hours, work with middle school students, and connect
with Winship faculty.
 
GSEI is led by Dr. Theresa Gillespie of Winship Cancer Institute and runs STEM outreach programs
that aim to provide meaningful health and data science education in the classroom and in the community. The programs are supported by the National Institutes of Health, National Institutes of 
General Medicine Sciences, and the NIH Office of Data Science Strategy through a Science Education Partnership Award Grant (R25GM146271).
 
GSEI's Data Detectives Summer Academy offers middle school girls a unique opportunity to explore real cancer data and tackle community health challenges using Big Data, Artificial Intelligence, and biomedical research. The program will be held at Emory University June 2-6 and July 14-18, 2025, from 9 AM to 3 PM daily. Participants will attend engaging lectures from Emory Winship faculty, work closely with STEM mentors, and gain hands-on experience in data science and epidemiology. STEM mentors will help run small-group discussions and workshops.
 
Apply here: https://www.ga-science.org/dd-stem-mentors-sign-up
 
Address any questions to info@ga-science.org
 
 
See attached flyer for details
 
 
 
 
 
ANOUNCEMENT FOR GRADUATING SENIORS
 
The Institute for Research in the Social Sciences (IRISS) at Stanford runs a program for recent undergraduate degree recipients who want to participate in social science research projects. Political Science faculty will lead several of the projects, and faculty from other departments will offering other opportunities (for details, click here).
 
In addition to the goal of advancing research, the IRiSS Predoctoral Research Fellowship Program is intended to:
·         create opportunities for predocs to deepen their knowledge of social science topics and methods, learn about options for advanced study, and build mentoring relationships to help launch their careers; and 
·         diversify the pipeline into academia and industry.
Applications for these one-year and two-year paid research fellowship positions are now being accepted. We would be grateful for your help in informing your graduating seniors and recent students with bachelor’s degrees about this new opportunity.
 
Submitted by Dr. Joe Sutherland
 
 
 
 
ANNOUNCEMENT 
of Emory SHINE — Emory Center for Civic and Community Engagement's premier service program with refugee, immigrant, and new American communities in metro Atlanta. 
 
Applications for the Emory SHINE 2025-26 Executive Board close this coming Friday, 11:59PM. As a member of our Executive Board, you will help coordinate 20+ volunteer trips weekly in partnership with 10+ non-profits in metro Atlanta. You will also organise social events and workshops that help foster polycultural understanding and community collaboration. Previous engagement with SHINE, whether through our events or volunteer trips, is preferred but not required. 
 
Available positions:
	•	Events Chair
	•	Trip Lead and Transportation Chair
	•	Marketing Chair
 
Apply here: tinyurl/SHINEexec2526
 
Let me know if you have any questions!
 
 
    
Submitted by Claire Gong
 
 
 
 
 
DATA CAMP RENEWAL
 
Having challenges opening the data camp link? 
 
It has been updated!
                                                                                                                                                                  
It is active from 11/13/2024-05/13/2025 see links below
 
 
 
 
 
 

 
 


 
Prerequisites
You must complete ALL prerequisites listed in order to enroll in these courses.
QTM 210
	•	Either QTM 120 or MATH 210 or MATH 211
QTM 220
	•	QTM 110
	•	QTM 150
	•	QTM 210 or ECON 220 or MATH 361 with a plan to co-enroll in MATH 362
	•	MATH 210 or MATH 211
	•	MATH 221
Elective Prerequisites
	•	QTM 385 prerequisites will be listed in the course description!!!
 
Equivalents
Below are courses that act as equivalents to the respective QTM courses
QTM 210:
	•	ECON 220 and [MATH 210 or MATH 211]
	•	OR - MATH 362
QTM 220:
	•	ECON 320 plus QTM 110, QTM 150, MATH 221 and [MATH 210 or MATH 211]
 
For General Academic Advising
Schedule an appointment at https://calendly.com/emoryqtm.
 
If you have any questions regarding the above information, please do not hesitate to reach out.
 
Best,
Sadie Hannans
QTM Program Coordinator
Shanna9@emory.edu   470-620-7981

subject: FALL 2025  QTM 302W COURSE SIGN UP
content:
Hello,
 
You are receiving this email because you filled out the form for the FALL 2025 QTM 302W course.  Please know that by filling out the form only lets us know you are interested in being considered for a permission code to register for one of the QTM 302W courses.   Filling out the form does not guarantee you will receive a permission code.  Dr. Jin Kim, Director of Undergraduate Studies(DUS) for the QTM Department will decide who will get a permission code for the course.  Per the professors’ request, graduating seniors will be given preference. Permission codes will be send out to selected students after March 28th Advising meeting which is at 1:15 PM – 2:30 PM in the PAIS 290.  Permission codes will be sent to those selected via email before March 31st.  The Advising Meeting  is very important especially for  those of you who have not been assigned a QTM advisor yet.   So please be in attendance.  If you have questions, please reach out. Thanks. 
 
HERE ARE OTHER OPTIONS TO TAKE QTM 302W COURSES  IN THE SUMMER  2025 ( no permission code required  - see atlas for more details about the course)
 
Two new offerings:
	•	ENGRD/QTM302W-1. Summer Session 2 (6/30-8/6).  TTh 11:30a-1pm.  Online.  Prof. Palermo
	•	ENGRD/QTM302W-2. Summer Session 1 (5/16-6/25). TTh. 8:15a-9:45a.   Online.  Prof. Miller
 
Best, 
 
Sadie Hannans
Undergraduate Program Coordinator
Department of Quantitative Theory & Methods
Emory University
Email: shanna9@emory.edu | 470-620-7981
(she/her/hers)

subject: special announcement - opportunities
content:
SPECIAL ANNOUNCEMENT
 
Applications for Peer Mentorship/Grader positions for Fall 2025 QTM Courses are now open! Course support personnel work 4-8 hours per week on average across the semester and receive QTM 398R credit hours based on their position. Applications for Fall 2025 courses are due by April 17th and priority will be given to early applicants. The courses that are hiring and more specific details about the positions are included in the application form.  As many positions may require you to attend their section, we recommend applying only once your own Fall 2025 enrollments are complete! 
 
Application for positions with QTM 100: https://forms.office.com/r/LkyaAw4y8M
 
Application for positions with other QTM courses: https://forms.office.com/r/341wsY0pq6 
 
For questions about the QTM 100 positions, please email Lora McDonald (lora.mcdonald@emory.edu); for questions about the non-100 positions, please email Prof. Cuttner (Allison.cuttner@emory.edu) 
 
Best, 
 
Sadie Hannans
Undergraduate Program Coordinator
Department of Quantitative Theory & Methods
Emory University
Email: shanna9@emory.edu | 470-620-7981
(she/her/hers)
